Talon:


Talon blushed too when she recieved the kiss and she said "Do you =
want to know what I do think?" and she kissed back in his lips then she blu=
shed more and said "and before you make promises, you must to know everythi=
ng... in private"said the femme while she watched Depthcharge and Rattrap c=
lose to them



From: Sandy 
Sent: Saturday, April 03, 2010 7:48 AM
To: nbw=
rpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
=


  
Tucson holds Talon's hand gently. Inside he could feel his heart thump=
ing a mile a minute. There was no denying it, this feeling was genuine, and=
 of all bots he never thought he too would feel this way about a femme. But=
 there it was, the utmost of sincerity, compassion and love. He couldn't qu=
ite tell Lord Elder, Kup or Elita that love was his first objective, becaus=
e he didn't know if they'd understand. Even a Prime has to fib a little at =
some point, just as long as it was harmless. In this case, it truely was. H=
e couldn't deny it, Like Rodimus, who had fallen in love with Nightlight, h=
e was definitely in love with Talon.

" I'd never forget about you Talon. A=
s a matter of fact, you were the main reason why I came here. I - had to te=
ll Lord Elder a slight fib because if he ever knew the real reason why I le=
ft, I - don't know if he'd really understand it.. I was thinking about you =
all the time I was away."

Rat Trap looks back, keeping his tiny fingers cr=
ossed for something wonderful to transpire. He looks to Depthcharge and the=
 others.

" I hope, I hope, I hope... It's a match made on Cybertron ya kno=
w. I think Wheels is a little bit of a shy guy, and ya know if this works, =
I think he'll come outa that tiny shell of his."

Tucson gently takes Talon=
's other hand and gently gives her a kiss on her cheek. After realizing his=
 actions, that slight shade of red returns around his faceplate.

" Oh, wow=
, where did - that come from? I - hope I didn't offend you in any way."

Ra=
t Trap catches his kiss out of the corner of his eye and soon a grin grows =
from one corner of his face to the other.

" Way ta go Wheels." 

Tucson co=
uldn't help but rest an arm over Talon's shoulder. He wanted very much to s=
eal a relationship yet he didn't want to appear too forward at the same tim=
e. Yet, at this moment, even through the darkest of times, a sheer happines=
s floods his emotions for the first time in ages. A happiness that can't ju=
st be bought with power and strength alone. 

" I suppose I better tell Lor=
d Elder the Truth shouldn't I? But I'd like very much for you to come with =
me Talon. After all, My promise to you is never leave your side, unless of =
course the spark in my body is extinguished through extreme means. Other th=
an that, nothing and no one will tear us apart."

He looks into her eyes wi=
th the utmost of sincerity.

"If anything were to happen to me, the power t=
hat the Matrix has given me, I hope to pass it to you, it's my wish, and my=
 promise. Now, let's get the pieces we need to put this matter of Unicron a=
nd everything else, to rest."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@..=
.> wrote:
>
> Talon:
> 
> "Tucson... Its beautiful... I dont know what to s=
ay"Talon smiled while she took the compass and she said "I've tought that y=
ou have forgotten me, but i was mistaken... I'm very happy to see you again=
"
> 
> Talon Blushed, she felt overhelmed with happpines, after her heart w=
as broken twice, she never tought that she was able to feel like right in t=
hat instant but at the same time a part of her was feared to suffer again
>=
 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Thursday, April 01, 2010 7:54 AM
> To: nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> 
=
> 
> 
> Tucson looks to Talon and gathers all his courage at this point to =
finally speak up and start the conversation.
> 
> " When I couldn't see any=
thing, you a great help in that first battle we fought together.. I - don't=
 think anyone else would have risked their life like you had, for me. A pie=
ce of " Old Junk" as Nightstrike put it.. After that, you stuck by me when =
you didn't have to. That meant quite a bit to me Talon. It still does. And =
now, in more ways than one.. I - meant what I said, you're more beautiful t=
han I ever imagined before I could see what you looked like. And not only a=
re you beautiful on the outside, you're also beautiful on the inside."
> 
>=
 He gently takes her hand.
> 
> " I'm sure you've heard this from a lot of =
other bots but I mean every word honestly. And I'd be honored if you could =
continue to be beside me not only in battle, but companionship." 
> 
> He r=
emembered an artifact, a tiny artifact that he had found on Atlantis. A com=
pass, which he was able to restore simply by feel alone. The compass also h=
eld a tiny pearl inside, as part of its decoration. He takes it out of his =
subspaced gauntlet, and presents it to Talon.
> 
> " Now I know why I held =
onto this for so long. Before I left Atlantis, I was working on restoring t=
his artifact. It's nothing large, but, I know it's valuable. I'd like you t=
o have this."
> 
> The pearl sparkles as lights touch it.
> 
> --- In nbwrp=
g@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
> >
> > "That will be fine. =
We've been so busy here thay I haven't had a chance to
> > do much of anyth=
ing," said Perseus, returning the salute.
> > 
> > Just then Depthcharge ca=
me out of the command center door, followed by
> > Kenzo.
> > 
> > "Ah, so =
you were the maximal in the CR chamber. I am Perseus, the leader of
> > the=
 Pasificus Maximals."
> >

with a formal tone. "If you
> > need to interrogate someone, I have some ex=
perience with that and may be
> > able to help." He turned to Tuscon, "May =
I accompany you?"
> >

 wrote:
> > 
> > Tucson had gotten Lord Elder's message. He wasn't quite su=
re who
> > Nightstrike worked for, and was happy for the word up.
> > 
> > =
"Thank you Lord Elder, I should have asked that before I left, my bad.
> > =
Tucson Prime out. Sorry Lord Perseus, it was Lord Elder. I'm glad he
> > co=
ntacted me because I didn't know that Nightstrike wasn't one of Hydras'
> >=
 men. But, I still need to question him of course. It's great to actually
>=
 > see you this time, sir."
> > 
> > He salutes Lord Perseus, and then look=
s over to Talon who smiles back to
> > him. He had not forgotten her. He ha=
d strong feelings for her and was
> > happy to see her for the first time.
=
> > 
> > " You're even more beautiful than I imagined before I could see yo=
u. When
> > I'm finished, I'd really like to - well.. You know um, get to k=
now you a
> > little better.. Er... I'm not good at this.. Anyway, I have t=
o go."
> > 
> > He visibly turns a slight shade of red around his optics. H=
e then gathers
> > himself to prepare to question Nightstrike as to Unicron=
's intentions. He
> > knew he had several things happening at once, and to =
be a Prime to him,
> > meant he had to be well rounded. He also felt that U=
nicron's objectives had
> > something to do with the opression that was hov=
ering over the planet. As
> > always, he was curious as to why things were =
happening.
> > 
> > " If it's all right with both of you, I'd like to ask N=
ightstrike some
> > questions. When in doubt, seek the answers from unlikel=
y resources...
> > Something I kind of learned on my own."
> >
